results.title: Spitfire over Australia
results.brief_description: During World War II, more than 650 Spitfire aircraft were delivered to the RAAF. This is the story of Colin Pay, who rebuilt one of those magnificent machines, a Vickers Supermarine Spitfire HF Mk VIII built in 1944, from the corroded hulk he acquired in 1982. It is now a superbly restored flying machine. Including some of the best air to air colour footage ever shot of a Spitfire in Australia, and archival footage of Spitfires in Darwin in 1943 and interviews with the pilots who originally flew them, this is the ideal video for avaition enthusiasts!

results.title: Cold comfort: Australia's nuclear responsibilities
results.creator_credit: Jack White and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Cold Comfort is a lively and incisive documentary on the local and global consequences of the decision to export Australian uranium. It presents statements by those who support the mining of uranium for nuclear energy purposes, alongside those who oppose it. The program incorporates archival footage, and contemporary interviews to chart Australia’s participation in atomic history. Presented in four sequences. “The Uranium debate”, “The History of the bomb”, “Transportation of radioactive waste” and “Fallout from Chernobyl and Three Mile Island”.

results.title: Right... from the start
results.creator_credit: John Julian, University of Melbourne and Queen Victoria Medical Centre
results.brief_description: This videotape is basically for training midwives and medical students and is about the principles of breastfeeding. Mothers are often subject to conflicting views and information about breastfeeding and this video tackles the problem.

results.title: Bird safari in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jenny Erdos, Laszlo Erdos and David Cook
results.brief_description: Filmed entirely on location in the Mallee type country of Southern Australia, this film explores the paradise that is shared by birds, plants and insects in their natural environment. Features wonderful close-ups of undisturbed wildlife while the background music is a beautiful symphony of bird songs and calls. Narrated by Fred Parslow.

results.title: Twentieth Century Masters
results.creator_credit: Terence Meast, Peter Isaac and Australian National Gallery
results.brief_description: The Twentieth Century Masters video features a selection from the 71 works exhibited in the Twentieth Century Masters exhibition at the Australian National Gallery, Canberra and the Queensland Art Gallery, in 1986. Shot at the Australian National Gallery this video includes a number of works in the gallery’s permanent collection by artists represented in the exhibition. School of Paris artists discussed on the video tape include: Picasso, Matisse, Bonnard, Derain, Chagall, Soutine and Modigliani. Other European artists considered are Paul Klee and Max Beckmann.

results.title: ICRC 1983
results.creator_credit: International Committee of the Red Cross
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the work that was carried out world wide by the Red Cross in 1983. Shows volunteers and delegates at work in Africa, Poland, Middle East, Thailand, South America and Granada.

results.title: Julie Julie
results.brief_description: Julie was sick of living in Broken Hill, so she bought a motorbike and left to ride around Australia. The film shows part of her journey and illustrates the sense of freedom and independence of young people breaking loose.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.1
results.brief_description: This program is the first of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. Presented by Professor Richard Fox, from the Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research, this program examines issues such as, what is cancer? and what causes cancer? Cancer specialists discuss these issues and comment on the influences of factors such as diet, environment and genetics.

results.title: The Madigan Line
results.brief_description: One of the most inhospitable and desolate regions on Earth, the Simpson Desert was to fight off many challenges to penetrate its seemingly impenetrable heart. Expedition after expedition tried and failed. Men died but still they came. This video faithfully reenacts the 1939 expedition of Dr. Cecil Madigan who successfully crossed Australias last frontier.

results.title: A Town like Alice
results.creator_credit: David Stevens, Henry Crawford and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Nevil Shute’s best selling novel, “A Town Like Alice” is set against the brutal chaos of World War 11 and centres on two prisoners of war an Englishwoman, Jean Paget and an Australian soldier Joe Harmon, whose romance begins during the takeover of Malaya in World War 11 and takes them to the vast Australian outback.
